required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of W-3 Polyunsaturated Fatty Acids on Serum Albumin Concentration in Patients With Acute Heart Failure, Hypoalbuminemia, and High Inflammatory Activity
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of W-3 Polyunsaturated Fatty Acids on Serum Albumin Concentration in Patients With Acute Heart Failure, Hypoalbuminemia, and High Inflammatory Activity

lead_sponsor.agency: Hospital San Juan de la Cruz

clinical_study.source: Hospital San Juan de la Cruz

brief_summary.textblock: Assess whether high doses of ?-3 fatty acids added to standard treatment of patients with acute hearta failure, hypoalbuminemia and high inflammatory activity, promotes an increase in serum albumin

detailed_description.textblock:
Assess whether high doses of ?-3 fatty acids added to standard treatment of patients with acute hearta failure, hypoalbuminemia and high inflammatory activity, promotes an increase in serum albumin
Assess the effect of high doses of ?-3 fatty acids added to standard treatment of patients with acute hearta failure, hypoalbuminemia and high inflammatory activity on:
- Inflammatory activity (C-reactive protein)
- The development of biomarkers (NTproBNP).
- The prognosis of patients evaluated by the combined event of death from any cause or readmission for heart failure within three months after randomization.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: Serum albumin levels in the fourth week

secondary_outcome.description: C-reactive protein levels in the fourth week
NTproBNP levels in the fourth week

secondary_outcome.measure: Combined event of death from any cause or readmission for heart failure
secondary_outcome.description: Combined event of death from any cause or readmission for heart failure within three months after randomization

arm_group.description: 4 daily capsules of polyunsaturated fatty acids omega-3, during 4 weeks. Each capsule contains: 460 mg eicosapentaenoic acid ethyl ester and 380 mg docosahexaenoic acid ethyl ester.
Capsules of similar appearance and flavor without active drug

intervention.description: 4 daily capsules of polyunsaturated fatty acids omega-3, during 4 weeks. Each capsule contains: 460 mg eicosapentaenoic acid ethyl ester and 380 mg docosahexaenoic acid ethyl ester.
4 daily capsules of similar appearance and flavor without active ingredient

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients aged 18 years or olders hospitalized for acute heart failure, chronic decompensated or new onset of any etiology, presenting hypoalbuminemia (serum albumin ?3,4 g / dl) and high inflammatory activity (CRP ?2,5 mg / dl).
Exclusion Criteria:
- Impending doom
- Participating in other clinical trials
- Treatment with ?-3 acids in the last month prior to admission
- Percutaneous or surgical treatment of the cause of heart failure during hospitalization.
- Pregnant women.
- Renal failure on dialysis.
- Chronic liver disease Child-Pugh B or C.
- Acute infectious process.
- Active malignant neoplasia.

facility.name: Hospital San Juan de la Cruz

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Hospital San Juan de la Cruz
